edu.um.cps2002.tile_game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.um.cps2002.tile_game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class performs all the logic of the game, taking care of the setting up of players, all interactions between the players and the map, and the generation of HTML code.
    Author:
    Luke Collins & Stefania Damato

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Map map
      This Map object contains a two-dimensional array of Tiles storing the tiles of the game (representing one of water, grass or treasure).
      private Player[] players
      Array of Player objects, one for each player of the game.
      private int round
      Stores the current round, incremented at the end of every gameplayRound().
      private java.util.Scanner sc
      Scanner object for user input.
      private Team[] teams
      Array of Team objects.

      A constructor for creating Game instances from a pre-existing map, given the players and teams.

        The default constructor.

      • Game

        Game(Player[] players,
     Team[] teams,
     Map map)
        A constructor for creating Game instances from a pre-existing map, given the players and teams. Used mainly for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        players - The players to be used in the game.
        teams - The teams to be used in the game.
        map - A pre-existing Map object for the game to be played in.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        The start() method takes care of the initial set up of the game.

        First the user is asked for the number of players (2-8) and the size of the map (5-50 or 8-50). The correctness of the user input is checked by the boolean method setPlayersMap(int, int). The user is also asked whether a safe or a hazardous map is to be used. Then a corresponding Map object is created (assigned to map) and a Player object is generated for each player (stored in players). Finally each player is assigned a starting position on the map (which is known only to the player, stored in Player.x and Player.y).

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        A simple getter for the map attribute.
        Returns:
        map - The Map object storing the tiles on which the game is played.

      • gameplayRound

        public boolean gameplayRound()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method carries out a single round of gameplay.

        First each player is asked to enter their move (one of U/D/L/R). Then the corresponding Player object in players has their current position updated (i.e. the player's Player.x and Player.y attributes via Player.move(char)), so long as the move is allowed (determined by the boolean playerMoveAllowed(Player, char)). If any player lands on a water tile, then they are sent back to their initial position (via Player.returnToStart()), whereas if any player lands on the treasure tile, they are declared winners and noWinners is set to false.

        Returns:
        noWinner - A boolean variable which is true when none of the players have found the treasure (i.e. won) and false if at least one of the players has found the treasure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Should one of the tiles in the map be different from grass, water or treasure.

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer(int playerNum)
        A simple getter, returning a specified Player object from the players array.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - Player number (where numbering starts from zero).
        Returns:
        The Player object in the specified position in the players array.

      • setPlayersMap

        boolean setPlayersMap(int numPlayers,
                      int mapSize)
        A boolean function which determines whether a choice of number of players and map size are admissible.

        By admissible, it is meant that the number of players can be between 2 and 8, and if there are less than 4 players then the map size can range from 5×5 to 50×50, whereas if there are more than 4 players, then the map size can range from 8×8 to 50×50.

        Parameters:
        numPlayers - The number of players.
        mapSize - The size of the map.
        Returns:
        true if the choice is admissible, false otherwise.

      • generateHTMLFiles

        void generateHTMLFiles()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Generates an HTML file for each player using the Map.generateHTML(Player, int) method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Should the writing of HTML files fail.

      • playerMoveAllowed

        boolean playerMoveAllowed(Player p,
                          char move)
        This method examines the player's current position and determines whether or not it is possible to move in a certain direction, ensuring that the player does not move out of the map.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to make the move.
        move - A direction character, one of u (up), d (down), l (left) or r (right).
        Returns:
        true if the move is admissible, false otherwise.
